author: cms-sw
body:
This PR updates many base level packages
- autotools:
  - autoconf: 2.72
  - automake: 1.16.5 ( 1.17 does not work see https://github.com/libffi/libffi/issues/853)
  - libtool: 2.4.7
  - m4: 1.4.19 (dropped m4-centos8 patch: already included in new version)
  - gettext: 0.22.5
- bz2lib: 1.08
- cmake: 3.30.3
- curl: 8.10.1
- expat: 2.6.3
- gdbm: 1.24
- gmake: 4.4.1
- libffi: 3.4.6
- libjpeg-turbo: 3.0.4
- libpng: 1.6.44
- libtiff: 4.6.0
- libuuid: 2.40
- nasm: 2.16.0
- sqlite: 3.46.1
- zlib: 1.3.1 and use consistent version for all archs
- zstd: 1.5.6
- xz: 5.6.2
  Used `-fno-fast-math` to build  `xz`  (see https://github.com/cms-sw/cmssw/issues/41773).  Looks like new `xz` version `5.6.2` is relatively faster than `5.2.5`. ROOT bench mark test https://github.com/cms-sw/cmssw/issues/41773#issuecomment-2328555041 timings are below (avg of 5 runs)
  - `xz 5.2.5 with -Ofast`:  8.251s
  - `xz 5.6.2 with -Ofast -fno-fast-math`: 8.1s
  - Generated root file size is exactly same for both.\
 
Also added missing `BuildRequires` on  `gmake/autotools` where needed
title: [PY312] Update various base level tools e.g zlib, xz, cmake and more
